means: 使满足(content的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: He contented himself by assuming an air of superiority.
sentence.Network_cn: 他表现出一副高高在上的样子以获得自我满足。
我们心满意足地回家了。

sentence.Network_en: Tania kept the children reasonably quiet and contented.
sentence.Network_cn: 塔妮娅把孩子们哄得安安静静而又心满意足。

entry.def: If you are contented, you are satisfied with your life or the situation you are in.

example.ex: Whenever he returns to this place he is happy and contented...
example.tran: 每次回到这个地方，他都十分快乐，心满意足。

example.ex: She was gazing at him with a soft, contented smile on her face.
example.tran: 她注视着他，脸上带着温柔而满足的微笑。

means.word_mean: 1. satisfied or showing satisfaction with things as they are;

auth_sentence.content: Julius contented himself with dividing it into four pieces.
auth_sentence.res_content: Julius contented himself with dividing it into four pieces.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Julius contented himself with dividing it into four pieces.

auth_sentence.content: Contented couples nest, chubbily piling on the pounds.
auth_sentence.res_content: Contented couples nest, chubbily piling on the pounds.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Contented couples nest, chubbily piling on the pounds.

auth_sentence.content: So you would expect pharmacists to be a pretty contented lot.
auth_sentence.res_content: So you would expect pharmacists to be a pretty contented lot.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So you would expect pharmacists to be a pretty contented lot.

means.word_mean: 满意的, 满足的; 知足的

sentences.en: He won't be contented until he's upset everyone in the office.
sentences.cn: 不把办公室里的每个人弄得心烦意乱他就不会满足。

jushi.english: A contented person is happy with what he has.
He seems quite contented and happy all the time.
jushi.chinese: 他好像总是非常知足和高兴。

jushi.english: We are contented to work for that company.
jushi.chinese: 我们心甘情愿为那家公司干活。
